entityRef.description: The reference to a single entity that should be refreshed

RefreshOptions.description: Options for requesting a refresh of entities in the catalog.

JsonObject.description: A type representing all allowed JSON object values.

Record_string.string_.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

type.description: An optional value to categorize links into specific groups

icon.description: An optional semantic key that represents a visual icon.

title.description: An optional descriptive title for the link.

url.description: The url to the external site, document, etc.

EntityLink.description: A link to external information that is related to the entity.

links.description: A list of external hyperlinks related to the entity.

tags.description:
A list of single-valued strings, to for example classify catalog entities in
various ways.

annotations.description:
Key/value pairs of non-identifying auxiliary information attached to the
entity.

labels.description: Key/value pairs of identifying information attached to the entity.

description.description:
A short (typically relatively few words, on one line) description of the
entity.

title.description:
A display name of the entity, to be presented in user interfaces instead
of the `name` property above, when available.

This field is sometimes useful when the `name` is cumbersome or ends up
being perceived as overly technical. The title generally does not have
as stringent format requirements on it, so it may contain special
characters and be more explanatory. Do keep it very short though, and
avoid situations where a title can be confused with the name of another
entity, or where two entities share a title.

Note that this is only for display purposes, and may be ignored by some
parts of the code. Entity references still always make use of the `name`
property, not the title.

namespace.description: The namespace that the entity belongs to.

name.description:
The name of the entity.

Must be unique within the catalog at any given point in time, for any
given namespace + kind pair. This value is part of the technical
identifier of the entity, and as such it will appear in URLs, database
tables, entity references, and similar. It is subject to restrictions
regarding what characters are allowed.

If you want to use a different, more human readable string with fewer
restrictions on it in user interfaces, see the `title` field below.

etag.description:
An opaque string that changes for each update operation to any part of
the entity, including metadata.

This field can not be set by the user at creation time, and the server
will reject an attempt to do so. The field will be populated in read
operations. The field can (optionally) be specified when performing
update or delete operations, and the server will then reject the
operation if it does not match the current stored value.

uid.description:
A globally unique ID for the entity.

This field can not be set by the user at creation time, and the server
will reject an attempt to do so. The field will be populated in read
operations. The field can (optionally) be specified when performing
update or delete operations, but the server is free to reject requests
that do so in such a way that it breaks semantics.

EntityMeta.description: Metadata fields common to all versions/kinds of entity.

targetRef.description: The entity ref of the target of this relation.

EntityRelation.description: A relation of a specific type to another entity in the catalog.

relations.description: The relations that this entity has with other entities.

spec.description: The specification data describing the entity itself.

kind.description: The high level entity type being described.

apiVersion.description:
The version of specification format for this particular entity that
this is written against.

Entity.description: The parts of the format that's common to all versions/kinds of entity.

Record_string.Array__value-string--count.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

facets.description: The computed facets, one entry per facet in the request.

info.title: @backstage/plugin-catalog-backend
info.description: The Backstage backend plugin that provides the Backstage catalog
